Key Match Events: Roston Chase pulled off a rescue act at the death as West Indies survived a scare against Papua New Guinea and won by 5 wickets to start their T20 World Cup campaign on a winning note.
Sese Bau top scored for Papua New Guinea with a steady 50 as wickets fell all around him against the West Indies as PNG posted 136/8 in 20 overs.
West Indies bowlers rattled PNG early when they sent back 2 batters for just 10 with Akeal Hosein cleaning up Lega Siaka and Romario Shepherd taking out Tony Ura.
Assad Vala tried to go at the bowlers but he was also dismissed by Alzarri Joseph with PNG losing 3 in powerplay.
Rovman Powell won the toss and West Indies will bowl first against Assad Valaâ€™s Papua New Guinea in the T20 World Cup at the Providence Stadium in Guyana on Sunday.
Pre-Game Insights: The match was the opening game of the T20 World Cup 2024.
West Indies have won the T20 World Cup twice before in 2012 and 2016.
Papua New Guinea, if they could spring a surprise in the World Cup, would be an achievement in itself.
Post-Match Reflections: No post-match reflections were provided in the article.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Providence Stadium in Guyana.
